info.title: Cloud PAW Management
info.description: Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune) Cloud Privileged Access Workstation (PAW) Lifecycle Management and Deployment App.

servers.description: A secured connection to the app, only secured connections should be used for production.
Used only for local dev, never host this app without network encryption.

tags.name: Debug Mode
tags.description: Endpoints that are exposed only in debug mode. You can use these to see as the app sees.

get.description: Returns a list of all devices registered to the Windows Autopilot service in Endpoint Manager.

400.description: Invalid Input. This is usually due to not following content type or input validation constraints.

500.description: Internal error. This is usually thrown because of a misconfiguration on the PAW architecture structure or some other internal error. See the server console logs/app insights for more info.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

get.description: Returns a list of all commissioned PAW devices managed by the Cloud PAW Management systems.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

post.description: Commissions a new device, into the device hierarchy and appends appropriate metadata and initial policies. Appends required metadata to proper locations.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: The AAD Device ID of the autopilot device to commission into a managed device.

Privileged.description: In this example, the target device in the URL path is commissioned as a PAW.

Developer.description: In this example, the target device in the URL path is commissioned as a developer workstation.

Tactical-CR.description: In this example, the target device in the URL path is commissioned as a Tactical PAW for CR operations.

Tactical-RRR.description: In this example, the target device in the URL path is commissioned as a Tactical PAW for RRR operations.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: The AAD Device ID of the autopilot device to decommission into a enterprise/user class device.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

get.description: Lists all of the users that are currently assigned to the specified device.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: The AAD Device ID of the managed device that will have all the user assignments listed.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

post.description: Replace the list of currently assigned users on the specified device.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: The AAD Device ID of the managed device that will have all the user assignments listed.

1:1 map.description: This example is the security best practice of having only one user mapped to a managed device.

Multi-User Managed Device.description: This example is the security best practice of having only one user mapped to a managed device.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

delete.description: Remove the specified user from the device and if they were the last user, wipe the device for the next user. If multiple assignments exist and only part of the users are specified, all remaining users are un-touched and the device is not wiped.

parameters.name: deviceID
parameters.description: The AAD Device ID of the managed device that will have the user assignments deleted.

Single User.description: Remove a single user assignment from a managed device.

Multiple Users.description: Remove multiple user assignments from a managed device.

520.description: App is starting still. Feature is not available. Please try again later.

525.description: Not deployed. Please deploy the infra before using the app.

get.description: Runs the Swagger UI render to render the OpenAPI spec that you are viewing now.

200.description: Returns the HTML for Swagger UI renderer's output

get.summary: Returns an access token in the app's auth context
get.description: Returns the access token that the web server is using for authenticating to the MS Graph API.

200.description: Successful Operation. You can securely decode the access token using https://jwt.ms

get.description: Returns a list of the enviornmental variables accessible to the API server

post.summary: Returns posted data to the caller.
post.description: Returns JSON data posted to the endpoint to test if the server is getting posts and can parse them.

Hello World.description: This example is a generic hello world example where the property name is hello and the value is world.

Multi-Property.description: This example is an object with multiple properties.

Hello World.description: This example is a generic hello world example where the property name is hello and the value is world.

Multi-Property.description: This example is an object with multiple properties.

schema.example:

post.summary: Create a new Role Scope Tag.
post.description: Creates a new Endpoint Manager role scope tag using the MS Graph API.

Name only.description: Create a role scope tag with a name only.

Name and Description.description: Create a role scope tag with a name and a description field.

get.summary: Return array of role scope tags.
get.description: Returns an array of all the role scope tag objects from the MS Graph API.

get.summary: Get the specific role scope tag
get.description: Get the role scope tag by the name of the tag. Returns the first match, if more than one match exists. This is possible if a duplicate display name value is specified during scope tag creation via the Graph API.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The display name property of the role scope tag to retrieve.

patch.summary: Update the specified role scope tag
patch.description: Update the specified role scope tag's values. The ID field is read only but can be specified to update the name field's value while operating on the specified entity ID.

Update Description.description: Updates the description field only as the name is used as the entity identifier.

Update Name and Description.description: Updates the name and the description fields as the ID is used as the entity identifier, allowing the name parameter to be written as the new display name. The name's value is grabbed from the identifier parameter.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The display name property of the role scope tag to update.

delete.summary: Delete the specified role scope tag
delete.description: Deletes the specified role scope tag based on the ID specified in the parameter.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The display name property of the role scope tag to delete.

pawDevice.title: PAW Device Object
pawDevice.description: A computed PAW object. This is generated by combining multiple pieces of metadata.

DisplayName.description: Current computer name of the device according to AAD. Empty string indicates that the device has not joined AAD yet

ParentDevice.description: DeviceID of the parent PAW device.

ParentGroup.description: ObjectID of the unique PAW group that the PAW is a member of.

UserAssignment.description: The ID of the Settings Catalog that contains the user rights assignment of the specified PAW device.

GroupAssignment.description: This is the ID of the Custom CSP Device Configuration that configures the local admin and local hyper-v group memberships.

CommissionedDate.description: This is the ISO 8601 string format of the time representing the commission date of the PAW.

@odata.type.description: The type indicator for the MS Graph API to consume.

id.description: A unique number representing the unique Role Scope tag object. This is an integer as a string. Key of the entity. This is automatically generated.

description.description: Description of the Role Scope Tag.

displayName.description: The display or friendly name of the Role Scope Tag.

isBuiltIn.description: This field is used to notate Microsoft managed Role Scope tags, e.g. the "default" tag.

microsoft.graph.windowsAutopilotDeviceId.title: Graph API - Windows Autopilot Device Identity

azureActiveDirectoryDeviceId.description: AAD Device ID - to be deprecated

deploymentProfileAssignedDateTime.description: Profile set time of the Windows autopilot device.

deploymentProfileAssignmentDetailedStatu.description: Profile assignment detailed status of the Windows autopilot device. Possible values are: none, hardwareRequirementsNotMet, surfaceHubProfileNotSupported, holoLensProfileNotSupported, windowsPcProfileNotSupported, surfaceHub2SProfileNotSupported, unknownFutureValue.

deploymentProfileAssignmentStatus.description: Profile assignment status of the Windows autopilot device. Possible values are: unknown, assignedInSync, assignedOutOfSync, assignedUnkownSyncState, notAssigned, pending, failed.

enrollmentState.description: Intune enrollment state of the Windows autopilot device. Possible values are: unknown, enrolled, pendingReset, failed, notContacted.

groupTag.description: Group Tag of the Windows autopilot device.

lastContactedDateTime.description: Intune Last Contacted Date Time of the Windows autopilot device.

manufacturer.description: Oem manufacturer of the Windows autopilot device.

model.description: Model name of the Windows autopilot device.

productKey.description: Product Key of the Windows autopilot device.

purchaseOrderIdentifier.description: Purchase Order Identifier of the Windows autopilot device.

serialNumber.description: Serial number of the Windows autopilot device.

allOf.description: The windowsAutopilotDeviceIdentity resource represents a Windows Autopilot Device.
